member.summary: Creates a meta-object for the specified object.

The expression representing this during the dynamic binding process.

member.returns: The representing the result of the binding.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicMetaObjectBinder.Bind(System.Object[],System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.Linq.Expressions.ParameterExpression},System.Linq.Expressions.LabelTarget)
member.summary: Performs the runtime binding of the dynamic operation on a set of arguments.
member.returns: An Expression that performs tests on the dynamic operation arguments, and performs the dynamic operation if the tests are valid. If the tests fail on subsequent occurrences of the dynamic operation, Bind will be called again to produce a new for the new argument types.
member.param: An array of arguments to the dynamic operation.
The array of instances that represent the parameters of the call site in the binding process.
A LabelTarget used to return the result of the dynamic binding.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicMetaObjectBinder.Defer(System.Dynamic.DynamicMetaObject,System.Dynamic.DynamicMetaObject[])
member.summary: Defers the binding of the operation until later time when the runtime values of all dynamic operation arguments have been computed.
member.returns: The representing the result of the binding.
member.param: The target of the dynamic operation.
An array of arguments of the dynamic operation.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicMetaObjectBinder.Defer(System.Dynamic.DynamicMetaObject[])
member.summary: Defers the binding of the operation until later time when the runtime values of all dynamic operation arguments have been computed.
member.returns: The representing the result of the binding.
member.param: An array of arguments of the dynamic operation.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicMetaObjectBinder.GetUpdateExpression(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets an expression that will cause the binding to be updated. It indicates that the expression's binding is no longer valid. This is typically used when the "version" of a dynamic object has changed.
member.returns: The update expression.
member.param: The property of the resulting expression; any type is allowed.

member.name: P:System.Dynamic.DynamicMetaObjectBinder.ReturnType
member.summary: The result type of the operation.
member.returns: The object representing the result type of the operation.

member.name: T:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject
member.summary: Provides a base class for specifying dynamic behavior at run time. This class must be inherited from; you cannot instantiate it directly.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.#ctor
member.summary: Enables derived types to initialize a new instance of the type.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.GetDynamicMemberNames
member.summary: Returns the enumeration of all dynamic member names.
member.returns: A sequence that contains dynamic member names.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.GetMetaObject(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Provides a that dispatches to the dynamic virtual methods. The object can be encapsulated inside another to provide custom behavior for individual actions. This method supports the Dynamic Language Runtime infrastructure for language implementers and it is not intended to be used directly from your code.
member.returns: An object of the type.
member.param: The expression that represents to dispatch to the dynamic virtual methods.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryBinaryOperation(System.Dynamic.BinaryOperationBinder,System.Object,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides implementation for binary operations. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as addition and multiplication.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the binary operation. The binder.Operation property returns an object. For example, for the sum = first + second statement, where first and second are derived from the DynamicObject class, binder.Operation returns ExpressionType.Add.
The right operand for the binary operation. For example, for the sum = first + second statement, where first and second are derived from the DynamicObject class, is equal to second.
The result of the binary operation.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryConvert(System.Dynamic.ConvertBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides implementation for type conversion operations. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations that convert an object from one type to another.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the conversion operation. The binder.Type property provides the type to which the object must be converted. For example, for the statement (String)sampleObject in C# (CType(sampleObject, Type) in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Type returns the type. The binder.Explicit property provides information about the kind of conversion that occurs. It returns true for explicit conversion and false for implicit conversion.
The result of the type conversion operation.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryCreateInstance(System.Dynamic.CreateInstanceBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that initialize a new instance of a dynamic object. This method is not intended for use in C# or Visual Basic.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the initialization operation.
The arguments that are passed to the object during initialization. For example, for the new SampleType(100) operation, where SampleType is the type derived from the class, is equal to 100.
The result of the initialization.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryDeleteIndex(System.Dynamic.DeleteIndexBinder,System.Object[])
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that delete an object by index. This method is not intended for use in C# or Visual Basic.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the deletion.
The indexes to be deleted.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryDeleteMember(System.Dynamic.DeleteMemberBinder)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that delete an object member. This method is not intended for use in C# or Visual Basic.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the deletion.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryGetIndex(System.Dynamic.GetIndexBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get a value by index. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for indexing operations.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the operation.

The indexes that are used in the operation. For example, for the sampleObject[3] operation in C# (sampleObject(3) in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the DynamicObject class, is equal to 3.
The result of the index operation.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as getting a value for a property.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to .

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryInvoke(System.Dynamic.InvokeBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that invoke an object. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as invoking an object or a delegate.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.
member.param: Provides information about the invoke operation.
The arguments that are passed to the object during the invoke operation. For example, for the sampleObject(100) operation, where sampleObject is derived from the class, is equal to 100.
The result of the object invocation.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryInvokeMember(System.Dynamic.InvokeMemberBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that invoke a member. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as calling a method.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleMethod(100), where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleMethod". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.

The arguments that are passed to the object member during the invoke operation. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleMethod(100), where sampleObject is derived from the class, is equal to 100.
The result of the member invocation.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TrySetIndex(System.Dynamic.SetIndexBinder,System.Object[],System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set a value by index. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations that access objects by a specified index.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.
member.param: Provides information about the operation.

The indexes that are used in the operation. For example, for the sampleObject[3] = 10 operation in C# (sampleObject(3) = 10 in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the class, is equal to 3.

The value to set to the object that has the specified index. For example, for the sampleObject[3] = 10 operation in C# (sampleObject(3) = 10 in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the class, is equal to 10.

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, the is "Test".

member.name: M:System.Dynamic.DynamicObject.TryUnaryOperation(System.Dynamic.UnaryOperationBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides implementation for unary operations. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as negation, increment, or decrement.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
member.param: Provides information about the unary operation. The binder.Operation property returns an object. For example, for the negativeNumber = -number statement, where number is derived from the DynamicObject class, binder.Operation returns "Negate".
The result of the unary operation.

member.returns: The of the expression.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Update(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression})
member.summary: Compares the value sent to the parameter, arguments, to the Arguments property of the current instance of DynamicExpression. If the values of the parameter and the property are equal, the current instance is returned. If they are not equal, a new DynamicExpression instance is returned that is identical to the current instance except that the Arguments property is set to the value of parameter arguments.
member.returns: This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.
member.param: The property of the result.

member.param: The expression to visit.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite
member.summary: A dynamic call site base class. This type is used as a parameter type to the dynamic site targets.

member.summary: Class responsible for binding dynamic operations on the dynamic site.
member.returns: The object responsible for binding dynamic operations.

member.summary: Creates a call site with the given delegate type and binder.

The call site binder.

member.summary: Dynamic site type.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite`1.Create(System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the dynamic call site, initialized with the binder responsible for the runtime binding of the dynamic operations at this call site.
member.returns: The new instance of dynamic call site.
member.param: The binder responsible for the runtime binding of the dynamic operations at this call site.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite`1.Target
member.summary: The Level 0 cache - a delegate specialized based on the site history.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite`1.Update
member.summary: The update delegate. Called when the dynamic site experiences cache miss.
member.returns: The update delegate.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder
member.summary: Class responsible for runtime binding of the dynamic operations on the dynamic call site.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder.Bind(System.Object[],System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.Linq.Expressions.ParameterExpression},System.Linq.Expressions.LabelTarget)
member.summary: Performs the runtime binding of the dynamic operation on a set of arguments.
member.returns: An Expression that performs tests on the dynamic operation arguments, and performs the dynamic operation if the tests are valid. If the tests fail on subsequent occurrences of the dynamic operation, Bind will be called again to produce a new for the new argument types.
member.param: An array of arguments to the dynamic operation.
The array of instances that represent the parameters of the call site in the binding process.
A LabelTarget used to return the result of the dynamic binding.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder.BindDelegate``1(System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite{``0},System.Object[])
member.summary: Provides low-level runtime binding support. Classes can override this and provide a direct delegate for the implementation of rule. This can enable saving rules to disk, having specialized rules available at runtime, or providing a different caching policy.
member.returns: A new delegate which replaces the CallSite Target.
member.param: The CallSite the bind is being performed for.
The arguments for the binder.
member.typeparam: The target type of the CallSite.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder.CacheTarget``1(``0)
member.summary: Adds a target to the cache of known targets. The cached targets will be scanned before calling BindDelegate to produce the new rule.
member.param: The target delegate to be added to the cache.
member.typeparam: The type of target being added.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder.UpdateLabel
member.summary: Gets a label that can be used to cause the binding to be updated. It indicates that the expression's binding is no longer valid. This is typically used when the "version" of a dynamic object has changed.
member.returns: The object representing a label that can be used to trigger the binding update.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteHelpers
member.summary: Class that contains helper methods for DLR CallSites.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteHelpers.IsInternalFrame(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Checks if a is internally used by DLR and should not be displayed on the language code's stack.
member.returns: True if the input is internally used by DLR and should not be displayed on the language code's stack. Otherwise, false.
member.param: The input
